Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with our choice”
Reviews.Author: Tony_W60
Reviews.Content: Many thanks to all before me who have given this hotel a positive spin, we weren't disappointed. Only a hop, skip & jump to the Metro Porte de Champerret station. We arrived in Paris on the EuroStar & from Paris Gare du Nord we took the #4 Porte d'Orleans line changing at Reaumur - Sebastopol for the #3 Pont de Levallois - Bécon line getting off at Porte de Champerret metro station. Lots of stairs involved so if you're not happy about taking your luggage this way, look at alternatives. Wife & I with our 23 yr old daughter in a triple room (2 rooms, double bed & single bed) on the top (2nd) floor with a little balcony in both rooms overlooking the court yard and very sheltered. It was winter but we had the window open for fresh air and it wasn't too cold. As many others before me have stated the staff are excellent, its very clean, on the small side and only stairs up/down. Plenty of eating options and we dined at Da Ugo (Italian) across the road from the hotel. Would stay here again if we came to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Charming little hotel”
Reviews.Author: CharlotteVLondon
Reviews.Content: We have litterally just returned from our trip to Paris and we choose this hotel based on the reviews on Tripadvisor. We were not disappointed. The hotel is easy to find and so near the metro station. An excellent basis to start your sight-seeing from, even Pereire train station is a 5 min walk from the hotel which can be utilized to start your journey to Chateau Versailles. The exterior of the hotel is really charming and the reception was great (in English as well). The room itself (no. 111) is not large, but it fits a twinbed perfectly. It was not our intention to spend a lot of time in the room, so we were fine with that. Our room was cleaned every day and it was spotless upon arrival. All-in-all we had an excellent stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great price!”
Reviews.Author: sophiesausages
Reviews.Content: Visited in October, stayed for three nights. Fantastic location, a metro, a bus station, and an RER within 2 minuites walk. Walking distance to arc de triumph and champs elysses, but when we didnt want to walk, the 92 bus ran every 10/15 mins to the arc de triumph which was very handy. Most tourist attractions are accessiable from the RER (Pereire-Levallois, Line C) and Metro stations (Porte De Champerret, line 3) without having to make several changes. The hotel had a many resturaunts, a mcdonalds, a subway, a kebab shop, numerous bakerys, supermarkets, pharmacies, wine bars etc within 5 mins walk, which was handy after a busy day out when we wanted to grab some food on the way home. Bakerys were fantastic, bought breakfast, lunch and a drink each morning, and didnt manage to spend more than 4 euros!! The hotel was clean, beds made up, bins emptied, room tidied on a daily basis. The room wasn't huge, but there was ample space for three people in the triple room. Bathroom with bath and shower was clean. Television with English Chanels and free wi-fi in all rooms. Flower box on window, made lovely view! The staff at the hotel were extremley friendly, and gave lots of information on how to get around Paris, the best ways to get to attractions. All receptionists spoke English and were very helpful, and staff even left the hotel to help us find a shop that was open at midnight on a sunday. Couldnt have asked for better! Easy to reach from Charles de Galle airport using Metro and RER (9.80euro return). Would stay again, and have recommended to friends! Lovely little hotel, made our stay in Paris fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Great location at a fair price!”
Reviews.Author: Ramesh27
Reviews.Content: It is not easy to find a clean and fairly priced hotel in Paris, just a few steps from a Metro station, and surrounded by street cafes and lovely restaurants of all types and styles. The Champerret Heliopolis is just that! I travelled with my wife to enjoy some days in Paris, and it was just perfect! We easily reached all attractions by Metro, the neighborhood was relaxed and safe, and the hotel a small treasure: clean, friendly, and at a fair price. The rooms are small, and the bathroom even more so, but everything was cleaned daily, and we got a very good value for our money. If you are traveling alone, or as a couple, I would recommend it - not so much, if you are in a larger family/group, or rely on the dependencies for additional services, which was not our case! Loved it, and would return, and recommend to friends and family!

Reviews.Title: “English Speaking staff”
Reviews.Author: William F
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in this hotel for one brief day while catching up on my jet lag. The staff was very friendly and spoke my language(English) The room was clean, the free WIFI had a strong signal and was easy to connect. Close to the Metro

Reviews.Title: “delightful!”
Reviews.Author: macgregorscairn
Reviews.Content: Easily the nicest (and largest single) room I had in 2 weeks of travel. Clean modern room off a lovely center courtyard, with the window facing a quiet street and geraniums in the window box. The lobby area is under construction but it doesn't interfere. Great quiet semi-residential neighborhood, with cafes, parks and shopping in easy distance, and a Metro stop a block away. The continental breakfast is not included and just a bit pricey, but so pleasant! If I ever return to Paris I won't want to stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Does the job”
Reviews.Author: johnnyboyDublin
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night on a brief visit to Paris. It's a 15 minute stroll from Porte Maillot where the Beauvais airport bus drops you off. Small room (aren't they all in Paris?), comfortable bed, clean bathroom, polite staff. If you get a reasonable rate for the night you can't go too far wrong. Metro just outside the door, supermarket, restaurants etc.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly adequate”
Reviews.Author: howards2010
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a single room as I was on a sporting tour with friends. The room was small, but clean and perfectly adequate. The staff were very friendly and all in all, it was great value for money. Location was good, in a quiet area and not too far from the metro and the main tourist attractions. I would definitely recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “telling friends about this place”
Reviews.Author: fromunda
Reviews.Content: Location was good, next to metro and strolling distance to Arc de Triomphe. Three person party, and still enjoyed. Clean and a very helpful staff. would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and charming Paris hotel”
Reviews.Author: mh24
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel at a relatively good value for Paris. It's a little far from the city center, but very easy to get to via the Metro with a stop only a block away. It's located in a charming Paris neighborhood with several restaurants around. The rooms were decent sized for Europe and provided clean, comfortable beds. The balconies were beautifully decorated with flowers and the staff was incredibly friendly. Definitely a good value and stay for Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Paris neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Dwntwnabrown
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights in a twin double room. Very clean. Lovely sidestreet that our windows opened out to ... We could see a Paris neighborhood wake up in the morning. VERY close to metro. And lots of great food. We stopped at the brasserie every morning for our croissants. Also, the staff is very, very nice and helpful. One of them brings his west highland white terrier with him to work so there's a very sweet and friendly 'house dog' when he works. Very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “nice stay”
Reviews.Author: ive1983
Reviews.Content: First of all Paris seems to be the quite expensive in terms of hotel prices comapring to other European capitals. Room was nice and cosy as for the two star hotel. The only disatventage could be it was quite small. The bathroom was spotlessly clean. We liked that it was in a residential area with some nice bakery and restaurants nearby. It was a 15 min walk to the Arc de Triomphe. We only used this room for the sleep, most of the time we were sightseeing. So for a short stay I would reccomend it, but if you like more space in a room then maybe look for something else...

Reviews.Title: “Great value in an otherwise expensive city”
Reviews.Author: jkaden
Reviews.Content: This hotel is slightly removed from the main sites but within walking distance (the metro is right across the street as well). Hotel staff were all incredibly welcoming, pleasant and helpful. Room was basic and clean. Garden facing rooms are likely quieter than rooms facing the street. The only heads up is the breakfast is NOT included in your stay and costs 10 Euro pp for a basic breakfast that you could get for half the price at a cafe.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and not that clean”
Reviews.Author: vickytizer
Reviews.Content: For the money you pay, this isn't a great hotel. We had a cockroach in our bathroom and the bedroom was grubby. Given that we paid 194 euros for two nights, this isn't the standard I expect. Really disappointed, and surprised given that the majority of reviews for this hotel are positive.

Reviews.Title: “Very good choice”
Reviews.Author: druen76
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent some days in Paris at the beginning of February and we chose Champerret Heliopolis because, among the hotels at walking distance from Porte Maillot (we were flying to Beauvais with Ryanair), it had both affordable rates and good reviews on Trip Advisor. We were satisfied with our choice. Our room was on the second floor (no lift); it was clean, but with very small space for clothes (which may be a problem in winter). We had a flat TV but no safe. We didn't have problems with noise from outside (we might see Avenue de Villiers from our window but were far enough from its noisy traffic); we cannot comment about wi-fi, breakfast (we always had it outside) and noise from other rooms (sorrounding rooms were empty during our stay). The bathroom was large and very clean, with towels changed every day. As for the hotel staff, they were helpful and friendly and all of them spoke English. Finally, the location of the hotel is great: it lies in a residential area which seemed quite safe even coming back late at night, at 10 minutes walk from Porte Maillot (15 minutes with luggage!), 50 m from the metro, with Tout Chaud (excellent for brekfast) and 2 fast foods around the corner and restaurants and brasseries very close.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing value; super-friendly staff; great experience!”
Reviews.Author: bexxy927
Reviews.Content: We booked a room for our Christmas trip to Paris based on Trip Advisor reviews, and we were not disappointed! This lovely, small hotel has more of a bed-and-breakfast feeling than a large, impersonal hotel. Over our 8 nights, we felt that we developed a relationship with the staff who were always friendly, helpful, and eager to please. The room was clean and nice, the location was FANTASTIC, the neighborhood had great ammenities (try Tout Chaud around the corner for late-night pain au chocolat), and the breakfast was DELICIOUS! I would never bother to try to find a different hotel in Paris. I would recommend this hotel to EVERYONE! What a wonderful experience!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: godsmack44
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a quiet part of Paris, very close to a metro stop. Several nice bars and restaurants around and walking distance to the Arch de Triomphe. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent little 2 stars hotel, 10 min walk from Centre des congrès Porte Maillot”
Reviews.Author: mvernez
Reviews.Content: Try the double room because single room are quite small. Breakfast is ok for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay close to Arc de Triomphe”
Reviews.Author: TheJustJ
Reviews.Content: It is a very good place to stay, close to metro, and bus stop, a few restaurants also. The room was clean and the staff was very friendly. The only cons (which are not a big deal): - The shower has no curtain - There is no elevator

Reviews.Title: “VERY CONVENIENT FOR VISITING ALL AREAS OF PARIS”
Reviews.Author: familyinparis
Reviews.Content: Clean and handy for our needs, visiting family, close to Metro, reasonably priced. Rooms quite small but who needs a large room when you have the sites of Paris to visit?

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful jewel and a great value!”
Reviews.Author: TravelDivaD
Reviews.Content: As a single female traveler I could not have been more pleased with the cleanliness of my room and private bathroom. My room was cheerfully decorated and I just LOVED the windowbox filled with blooming geraniums outside my window. Yes ,the room was "Paris cozy" but it meet my needs. The staff was super friendly and the desk staff spoke English. I stayed for 3 nights and paid about $300 US in total. This was a great value based on my reseach of similiar accomodations. I also saved by paying the single rate. The hotel is centrally located near a bus depot and metro stop (#3 line to Porte de Champerret). I would take the metro at 12pm at night and still feel safe walking back to the hotel. I agree with my fellow TripAdvisors to stay clear of the hotel breakfast and head to one of the local bakeries. There is one next to the McDonald's and some better ones down Rue de Villiers. There is a supermarket around the corner from McDonald's. I had one suitcase so I took the Metro to the RER line to the airport. There is an information booth in the Metro and they will help you purchase the ticket and tell you the best route. The metro is $1.60 Euro and the RER (B3)to CDG airport (get off at terminal #2) is $8.50 Euro. It takes about 1 and 1/2 hrs. Also look into getting a Metro pass that can save you $$. Thanks to all my fellow TripAdvisors who recommended the Hotel Champerret Heliopolis!

Reviews.Title: “Simplicity”
Reviews.Author: LoopZilla
Reviews.Content: This hotel was exactly what we wanted. Although a 2 star, it feels above that grade. We had everything in the room that we needed. No mini-bar, but we did not want one. The door entry system was good idea - that is you always have to buzz to get in. Our room was at the back, and was very quiet. Great location - good for walking and transport.

Reviews.Title: “A very clean comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Terry014
Reviews.Content: hotel Champerret Heliopolis was a very nice suprise.The rooms were on the small side, but as we had come to Paris to watch the final stage of the Tour de France we were not in the rooms very much. The rooms and indeed the whole hotel was kept scrupulously clean and an adequate breakfast was served. The staff were very friendly and helpfull. The location was excellent in an area with many good restuarants, close to the bus station and metro stations and within easy walking distance of many of the famous sites including the Arch ge Triumph, Les Invalides and The Louvre. To sum up I would reccommend the hotel as a good value hotel at very competitive rates

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Staros
Reviews.Content: My husband and daughter and I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights and loved every night. The room was small but clean cozy. We had two little balconies looking into a center courtyard with lots of beautiful flowers on them. The receptionist was so friendly when we arrived exhausted and wanted to leave our bags all the way through to the end of our trip. His English was great but he let me dust off my old French and use that rather than forcing English. Everyone was friendly and helpful and the street noise wasn't much bother. We had no AC, but we weren't in the room during the day - we'd open the doors when we came in in the evening and the room cooled off nicely so we could close them before going to sleep. The neighborhood was nice but it did require some manuevering on the metro. Definitely worth it though.

Reviews.Title: “Such a nice and cozy hotel, will go back.”
Reviews.Author: mxu
Reviews.Content: This was the second hotel we stayed at Paris. Its location is not pure centre of the city but 2min-walk from the metro station Port de Champerret which is just under a terminal station of several buses. Taking bus No.92, you can get to Arc de Triomphe in 5min. The street of the hotel is the quietest compared to the neighborhood so we didn't feel noisy even our room had windows towards the street. The hotel is well decorated by the ower in a neat and lovely style. The man of young couple should be careful as the ower is a very gentle and handson guy:-) He is only at day shift. We arrived early right from the railway station after a night train but he managed to asking the staff to make a room ready for us in 30min. We were in room 211, with enough space and equipment, very clean and confortable. There's no lift, which could be the only minus. There's a little yard that two of the rooms has balcony above, could be wonderful to stay in those two rooms. Wifi signal covers the rooms. The ower has a cute dog. We paied 69euro for our double room.

Reviews.Title: “A fair hotel in a fantastic neighbourhood!"”
Reviews.Author: brunowsky
Reviews.Content: We liked very much the hotel. Minor caveats were the absence of air conditioning system + the hot temperatures in Paris + we had to sleep with windows closed because of noise in the street. But the hotel is very well located, and nearby there is plenty of options of restaurants, market places, etc. The staff speaks English and is very attentious. I would definitely recommend this hotel for friends.

Reviews.Title: “A cosy, superclean hotel in a well located place”
Reviews.Author: Diane_Harry
Reviews.Content: Your holidays really start at the moment you enter the hotel. It breathes a French atmosphere, in a small Parisian street, very close to public transport and on walking distance (15 min.) from Arc the Triumph and Champs Elisées. We'll be back! Harry & Diane

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, great staff except one.....”
Reviews.Author: ottantunoerre
Reviews.Content: Had fantastic 4 days at this small, friendly hotel. Rooms are small but VERY clean and cosy. The owner of the hotel was often there and was very kind. 3 guys at the reception, 2 of them where very kind, helpful and always had a smile on there face it was a real pleasure to have them as receptionists. Only problem encountered was with the guy that did the night shifts who on both occasions was in the the room in front of the reception watching tv in bed and didn't come to give us the key for a good 10 minutes after having made as much noise as possible to get his attention. He didn't seem to care much about what was happening around him and was not polite. It's a real shame because all other staff where so nice and friendly, I really think it's a shame that this lovely hotel is ruined by one person.

Reviews.Title: “Simply and good is better”
Reviews.Author: guybrush86
Reviews.Content: It's a simply and little but nice hotel! It's placed in a quite area of Paris and very close to the metro, therefore it's very easy and quick to get the centre of the city. The staff is kind and always present at the reception, the room is quite small but there's all you need !

Reviews.Title: “It's tiny hotel but very good condition!”
Reviews.Author: Eli2008London
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very tiny hotel and the room I stayed was very tiny but it's nice and crean. I love the bed. The mattress and pillow are soft but not too soft. It's very confortable and I could sleep very well. The staff of hotel are nice. It takes 1minute from the station. It was the fifth time I have visited Paris. I love Paris so I will visit Paris again and again. I think I probably chose this hotel again because there are so many hotels in Paris and so many rubish hotels among them and always difficult to chose a nice hotel within my budget. I definetely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AleksandarS
Reviews.Content: We (me and my wife) have stayed in this hotel in late october 2008. We payed 96 eur for double room (it is cheap for Paris), but it was money well spend. It was really a pleasant surprise . Last year I have stayed in Paris in 4stars Hotel ,and believe me that it is not better by any mean than Champerret Heliopolis. It is very clean, the location is very good. I mean it is the 17th arrondisment, but it is located some 50 meters from Porte de Champerret Metro station. And for Paris that is very important. The neighbourhood is one of the safest in Paris, (at least that is what I have been told by the people who live in Paris). It is quiet Hotel, the staff are very frienldy and speak very good English . We didn't took the Hotel Breakfast since there are numerous places nearby with croissants . I would highly recommend this Hotel for Budget travalers- it is extremely clean and has good location. Not to forget that just near the Metro station there is a bus stop, and if one take number 92 for 5-6 minutes is exactly at Arc de Triomphe.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Champerret”
Reviews.Author: FrenchieJR
Reviews.Content: We loved the linens on the beds, the excellent breakfast and the staff who helped us so much and were very pleasant. We liked eating breakfast in the open area and we also liked the location. We could walk or catch the Metro. Wonderful place.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay in Paris...”
Reviews.Author: juvalen
Reviews.Content: My parents and I had a great stay in Paris at this hotel. We liked everything: the cozy room for 3, the windows of the room went out to the small yard so it was calm to sleep and have a rest, the breakfast every morning, good atmosphere, polite and welcoming staff. The hotel is about 20 min. walk from the Arc de Triompe and the metro station is very near the hotel. Near the hotel we found some nice restaurants to have a meal so we were totally satisfied. I already recommended this hotel to my collegue...a great value for money and nice experience!

Reviews.Title: “excellent-moreso if you are flying into Beauvais”
Reviews.Author: hmm_messiah
Reviews.Content: 3 in our group, inc. 70 yr old granny. We walked to the hotel after arriving at Porte Maillot from Beauvais with Ryanair. lovely clean rooms, window boxes etc. Granny thanked me often for booking her a lovely room. We did not bother with hotel breakfast , pastry shop, cafes just few metres away, as were some brasseries and restaurants. We arrived near 11pm and ate maybe 20 metres from the hotel. Same night we also walked from hotel to the Arc de Triomphe. Very very convenient location, so close to the bus drop off from the airport. and a matter of footsteps to a Metro stop. The staircase might be difficult for some one not very mobile otherwise I would highly highly recommend. They also accommodated us when we required an extra night due to difficulties with schedules .

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: twotwo
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a wonderful two night stay in Paris where we stayed at the Champerret Helipolis. We found this hotel to be a clean,friendly and cheap little hotel in a great location. The room cost 76 Euro per night and was a good size. Consisting of a large comfortable double and a single bed. The bathroom was modern and clean and the flat screen TV was an unexpected extra. There was plently of soft white towels for your use and shower gel etc provided. The room was cleaned daily and cleaning staff as well as reception staff were very friendly. The hotel has a buzzer system and we were always allowed access promptly . There is a small outside terrace area that looked very nice and a selection of magazines and leaflets were at the reception for your use. The area is also very good and it was great to leave the bustle of central Paris to come to the area which had plenty of nice bars,cafes and restaurants.We did not use the hotel breakfast but ate at one of the local cafes or got some pastries from the shop virtually next door. The Metro is also right out side so its very handly for everywhere. Its also an easy and pleasant walk to the Arc de triomphe. I wouls also recommed this hotel if you arrive on the Beauvais airport bus as it is an easy 10 min walk fro the bus terminal. All in all a great little hotel I can highly recommend and I will certainly be using it on any future trips to Paris. The bin men did come early -around 0630 at the weekends but hey its Paris whats more beautiful than getting up early and going seeing the sights before the crowds. You can sleep when you get home..

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Champerret Heliopolis
HotelInfo.Address: 13 rue d'Heliopolis | 17th Arr., 75017 Paris, France
